image.altText: CDP participant at Crowhurst

props.synopsis: Three Aboriginal Northern Territory councils say they will cancel leases critical to the rollout of the federal government's new jobs program after they claim they were overlooked for funding because they were "not Aboriginal enough".

title.children: Remote councils threaten to disrupt $2.6b federal remote jobs program

image.altText: A montage of images including the back of a person and two newspaper clippings, one with a headline about "fondle claims".

props.synopsis: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

title.children: Victims say paedophile teacher groomed them to believe students were his 'wives'

image.altText: A wide shot of a brick building, tin roof, with front sign reading 'Holy Spirit Church, slightly obstructed by green bushes

props.synopsis: Police charge a 38-year-old man who allegedly stabbed a Darwin priest in the face with a pen while he was setting up for evening mass.

title.children: Man charged after Darwin priest stabbed in face with pen while setting up for mass

image.altText: A man photographed  from behind, watching horse racing on pub TV screens.

props.synopsis: Three weeks after an ABC investigation raised allegations against the NT's gambling commission, the government is refusing to answer straightforward questions about what's being done â€“ if anything.

title.children: Five questions the NT government won't answer after Four Corners investigation

image.altText: A person's hands are illuminated by the pale glow of a computer screen, as they type in a dark room.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has moved to restrict Freedom of Information request laws which, if passed, would block an environment group's long-running attempt to seek historic documents.

title.children: NT bill attempts to shield backbenchers from Freedom of Information laws

image.altText: Three people walking - men either side of one Aboriginal woman in focus. She has a soft expression, dark blue top and blazer on.

props.synopsis: Senator Namijinpa Price has denied being "hypocritical" after court hears she accused the Central Land Council of defamation ahead of the Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: Senator's previous defamation claims against land council aired in court

image.altText: A little girl on the beach wearing a cap and pink top

props.synopsis: The family of a 22-month-old girl who died at a Northern Territory child care centre last year are calling on the government to ban the type of fencing that caused her death under the banner of "Ebony's Law".

title.children: Toddler's family call for 'Ebony's Law' after childcare centre death

image.altText: Four men, tanned, all have black hair, standing in dark blue uniform top and shorts, which have logo 'John Moriarty Football'

props.synopsis: Trailblazing Aboriginal soccer star and Yanyuwa man John Moriarty started a soccer program which has been drivingÂ change in remote communities across the country.

title.children: Trailblazing Aboriginal soccer star drives change in remote communities

image.altText: A shot from a low angle of a middle-aged woman in black sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: In 2020, Australia massively increased welfare payments and conducted a live experiment in ending poverty, but when the subsidy was removed, many were thrown back into hardship.

title.children: Price of poverty hurts us all, yet research reveals an easy fix

image.altText: Man and policeman

props.synopsis: The family of a 43-year-old one-punch attack victim told his killer their lives "have been shattered beyond recognition" during an emotional Queensland court hearing.

title.children: One-punch killer Joshua Berrigan sentenced to 10 years' jail

image.altText: A man wearing a navy blue suit stands next to a woman wearing a navy blue dress

props.synopsis: Ten people to go on trial over cyberbullying of French President Emmanuel Macron's wife Brigitte Macron after they allegedly made "malicious" comments online spreading claims she is a man.

title.children: Ten face trial accused of cyberbullying France's first lady Brigitte Macron

image.altText: A man in a cap looks a the camera

props.synopsis: As juveniles in Kununurra continue to be arrested over car thefts, community leaders and the government are looking for solutionsÂ

title.children: Kununurra leaders say night space key to solving youth crime

image.altText: A WA Police officer holds a small black metal detector wand.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police confirms despite five knife-detecting wands being available, none were being used by officers in Hobart on the night of an alleged stabbing murder.

title.children: Knife-detecting wands not used by police on night of fatal Hobart stabbing

image.altText: Britainâ€™s King Charles reacts by holding his hand up to his head

props.synopsis: The protester outside the cathedral could also be heard saying "have you asked the police to cover up for Andrew, sir?"

title.children: King Charles heckled with 'how long have you known?' about Prince Andrew

image.altText: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu speaking.

props.synopsis: Some of the most senior officials from the US arriving in Israel has prompted some to re-imagine the phrase "Bibi-sitting" â€” and question the motive behind it.

title.children: US officials descending on Israel spark claims of 'Bibi-sitting'

image.altText: A woman in a grey blazer, with shoulder-length red hair, stands in front of an old wooden chest in parliament.

props.synopsis: Telcos are ordered to maintain a real-time public register of any outages affecting their networks as the government scrambles to re-establish trust in the triple-0 system.Â Follow live.Â

title.children: Telcos ordered to make network outages public in real time

Telcos ordered to make network outages public in real time

image.altText: Two men and a woman, who are brothers and sister, smiling.

props.synopsis: Virginia Roberts Giuffre's brothers are calling for the Epstein files, which they believe include videotapes, to be released. One says he knew for years about her allegation against their father.

title.children: 'Known for a long time': Giuffre's brother opens up on rape allegations against father

image.altText: Penguins near Casey Station

props.synopsis: A document linked to the arrest of a scientist has raised questions about whether Russia has long-term ambitions to exploit oil resources in Antarctica, where mining is banned indefinitely.

title.children: Russia's interest in Antarctic oil exposed after scientist's arrest

image.altText: A close-up shot of a man pointing as he speaks to reporters inside a plane cabin.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has ruled out running for vice-president in 2028, which some supporters have suggested could see him circumvent a constitutional bar against serving a third term.

title.children: Trump says he 'would love' third term but rules out vice-president run

image.altText: Palm trees blowing in strong winds before a hurricane hits jamaica

props.synopsis: Having intensified into a category five system, Hurricane Melissa looks set to be the strongest hurricane to hit Jamaica since record-keeping began in 1851.

title.children: Hurricane Melissa could be strongest recorded storm to hit Jamaica

image.altText: A woman with a pair of glass at an annual dinner

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank governor tells a Sydney gathering of economists she and her overseas counterparts are perplexed by what they call "sanguine" financial markets. They question is whether it will "all end in tears".

title.children: 'Might all end in tears': Central bankers watching global markets

image.altText: A man wearing a necklace and a tshirt with of a man's picture printed on it with the words Bring Itay Home Now

props.synopsis: The father of one of the dead hostages still in Gaza says he does not trust Hamas's assurances it is doing all it can to find and return the remains of Israelis.

title.children: Israeli families wait for release of remaining hostages in Gaza

image.altText: A graphic of a young unidentified girl sitting on a chair, her face down, in a Family Court waiting room.

props.synopsis: Sally's legal battle in the Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia may be years long gone, but the trauma of the experience lingers â€” especially on her eldest child.

title.children: Kids left powerless in 'disgusting custody battles' at Family Court

image.altText: A man close camera with fingers touching tips

props.synopsis: In his 2025 Boyer Lecture, former deputy prime minister John Anderson reflects on democracy and the end of the liberal global order.

title.children: The liberal global order that has defined our age is coming to an end

image.altText: A person in orange and green tracksuit holds an Australian flag with a group of people dressed the same in a full stadium

props.synopsis: In the year 2000, few things would have pushed back the nightly ABC News bulletin. When a wheelchair race did, legendary broadcaster Karen Tighe knew the Paralympics had truly arrived in Australia.

title.children: How a delayed news bulletin changed the Australian Paralympic movement

image.altText: A render of the west gate tunnel entrance showing a ventilation structure.

props.synopsis: Victoria's emergency services are unprepared for critical incidents in Melbourne's soon-to-be-opened West Gate Tunnel, senior firefighters warn.

title.children: Top firefighters say West Gate Tunnel not safe until checks completed

image.altText: Woman holding dog, smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Emma's brain tumour has stopped growing since she gained access to a type of immunotherapy identified by molecular testing.

title.children: Doctors are learning what makes cancers tick, to help shut them down

image.altText: A grey storm cloud sits above a truck parked on the side of a road.

props.synopsis: A cool change on Tuesday will provide welcome relief after the extreme heat experienced across Queensland since the weekend.

title.children: Temperatures plummet across Queensland after record-breaking heat

image.altText: A Matildas player puts her hand up to protect her face as an England striker blasts the ball into the net with her right foot.

props.synopsis: Ella Toone's goal helped England break Australian hearts at the 2023 Women's World Cup. She knows, and Steph Catley admits, the Matildas are out for "revenge".

title.children: Broken-hearted Matildas after revenge against England

image.altText: An Australian tennis player grimaces as he looks away during a singles match in Paris.

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin is knocked out of the Paris Masters, while the victorious Alexander Bublik walks off court without acknowledging the Australian.

title.children: Popyrin snubbed for handshake after Paris Masters loss

image.altText: A close-up shot of a woman with brown hair

props.synopsis: Lithuania has drawn up plans to shut its border crossings with Belarus indefinitely, after the capital's airport was repeatedly disrupted by suspected sightings of balloons carrying contraband cigarettes.

title.children: Lithuania vows to shoot down Belarus smuggler balloons disrupting air traffic

image.altText: A political poster about ramping.

props.synopsis: If Laborâ€™s 2022 campaign was all about ambulance patients locked out of hospitals, then 2026 is all about young people locked out of home ownership.Â

title.children: From ramping crisis, to housing crisis: SA Labor's messaging pivots

image.altText: A large brown bear followed by two small bear cubs walking in a rocky area.

props.synopsis: A record number of fatal attacks has prompted one regional leader to call for more help in dealing with the problem.

title.children: Japan asks army to cull bears after spike in fatal attacks

image.altText: a red missile head poking out from underneath a sheet while two workers in white lab outfits work on the missile

props.synopsis: Russia says the 9M730 Burevestnik "Storm Petrel" is "invincible" to current and future missile defences, with an almost unlimited range and unpredictable flight path.

title.children: Trump tells Putin Russian missile test not 'appropriate'

image.altText: a man in a suit with the shirt and blazer buttons undone

props.synopsis: A Sydney MP has told a gay magazine about his battle with post-traumatic stress disorder and how he turned to exercise and medical cannabis to manage it.Â

title.children: Alex Greenwich opens up on abuse after Mark Latham's graphic post
